sponsor.partnerMessage: Beth Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: The Symphony & Poetry Combine For A Free Performance
posts.content:
A pairing that just makes sense, the Symphony of Northwest Arkansas (SoNA) and poets from the Open Mouth Literary Center (OMLC), are partnering for a free performance next Saturday, April 2, at the Fayetteville Public Library Event Center. 

  • Words and music: The event is called SoNA Beyond: Transcending Words. SoNA singers will sing nine poems from poets with the OMLC, and three local poets will read poems that were written inspired by the music selected for the event. 
  • New age: The show is part of a SoNA series with the intent to stretch the possibilities of classical music, rethink what a symphony can do, and reach new audiences in new and innovative ways that include and immerse the NWA community. 

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: Coffee Shop Chain Coming To Fayetteville
posts.content:
We know you’ll never get tired of hearing this: There’s a new coffee shop coming soon to Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Never too many: Evelyn Hills in Fayetteville is getting a new tenant by the company name of Summer Moon Coffee, which is a franchise is based in Austin, TX. The Fayetteville location will be the coffee shop’s 36th location, but the first one in Arkansas. 
  • Moon milk coming soon: Summer Moon Coffee specializes in wood-fired roasted coffee and its signature “moon milk” sweet cream. Renovations of the new space are currently underway in Fayetteville, and there are hopes to be open sometime this summer. 

For more details, click HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday everyone! Spring break is coming to an end for some of you. Here are some events to wrap up your week:

  • Family Fun: The Fayetteville Public Library is going all out this weekend for families of all ages! There will be a PG movie night, a live Curious George Show, and an album release concert this weekend.
  • Ya like jazz?: Cache Studios in Bentonville is hosting Yuni Wa and Rodney Block Jazz Project for “It's In The Air” this Saturday, and you won't want to miss it.
  • Winehouse: Don’t miss out on the Amy Winehouse Experience coming to the Meteor guitar gallery in Bentonville on Saturday!
  • Cats and Kites: The 30th annual kite festival is coming back to Turpentine Creek tomorrow.
  • The Hunt: Ozark Outdoor Foundation's Basecamp is concluding this weekend in Bentonville with a citywide scavenger hunt among other classic festivities.
  • Mini Moth Market: On Saturday, Hawk Moth Brewing will host its first Mini Makers Market.
  • Wine and Photos: Join Mavis Wine Co. in Rogers this Saturday as they celebrate the work of a local fine art photographer.

Alright folks, have a wonderful weekend! Be safe, and bye for now!

posts.title: Tax Revenue In NWA Continues To Grow
posts.content:
The collective sales tax revenue for the “big four” was up almost 14% according to the March report, and each city’s gains are in the double digits.

  • The latest: The March report shows the numbers from the 1% tax charged for goods and services in January. The four cities collected a total of $7.64m of revenue, according to March’s report. Rogers was up 11.87% in revenue, Bentonville +22.23%, Fayetteville +10.56%, and Springdale +11.83%.
  • Up in numbers: Compared to the first three months of reports from 2021, the four cities have collected 13.28% more revenue from sales tax this year. The collective revenue from the first three reports is $24.75m. 

To see Talk Business & Politics’ breakdown of the numbers, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• *Correction: We wrote in our last newsletter that Susie Q. Malt Shop is the oldest restaurant in NWA, when in fact, that title belongs to Neals Cafe in Springdale.
  • Festival: Tickets for the upcoming Willie Nelson Outlaw Music Festival go on sale today. 
  • World’s largest retailer: Top 50 Global Retailers list of 2022 continues to have Walmart in the no.1 spot.
  • Making moves: The leadership at XNA is pursuing an on-site hotel.
  • Let's go! JJ's Grill advanced to the elite eight in a nationwide bar contest!
  • On the trails: Here's the 2022 list of the top places to mountain bike. You already know.
  • Roads: There's a new roundabout coming to Rogers.
  • Get a spot: Are you interested in advertising with us? Check out our advertising deals here!
